DOC.brief_summary: Objective : To show 1-2 day reduction caloric intake reduce insulin resistance produce several day overnutrition . Approach : Healthy volunteer admit Clinical Research Center undergo baseline euglycemic-hyperinsulinemic clamp study assess insulin resistance . Subjects start overnutrition program 4 day consist 3 meal 3 snack contain ~6,000 Kcal/24hours . A second clamp study perform day 5 demonstrate overnutrition induce increase insulin resistance . Starting day 5 subject 's caloric intake reduce ~1,000 Kcal 2 day ( day 5 6 ) . After morning day 7 , third hyperinsulinemic-euglycemic clamp perform determine whether reduce caloric intake reduce insulin resistance volunteer discharge Clinical Research Center .
DOC.brief_title: How Quickly Can Effects Excessive Caloric Intake Insulin Resistance Reversed ?
DOC.detailed_description: Study volunteer admit Clinical Research Center Temple University Hospital . After overnight fast , body composition determine non-invasively bioimpedance analysis ( 4 ) 4 h euglycemic-hyperinsulinemic clamp ( use FDA-approved regular insulin ) previously describe ( 5 ) perform serum sample obtain measurement glucose , insulin , free fatty acid , ketone body lipid . Oxidative stress ( 6 ) measure 24 hour urine collection ( analyzed isoprostene content ( 8-isoPGF 2α ) throughout study period . Respiratory gas exchange rate ( 7 ) determine hourly interval ( metabolic cart ( True One , Parvo Utah ) clamp study day Days 2 6 . After , ( 1 PM Day 1 ) volunteer start diet program 4 ½ day , consist 3 meal 3 snack 24 hour period contain ~ 6000 Kcal/24 h. The main meal ( contain ~ 1500 Kcal/meal ) serve ~ 8AM ( breakfast ) , 1PM ( lunch ) ~ 7PM ( dinner ) , snack ( ~ 500 Kcal/each ) ~ 11 AM , 4PM 11PM . On day 5 6 , volunteer receive 3 meal , contain ~333 calorie . Each morning blood sample obtain measure glucose insulin , free fatty acid ketone body . Daily 24 h urine collection obtain day . In morning Days 5 7 , procedure describe Day 1 repeat . In afternoon Day 7 , volunteer discharge hospital .
DOC.criteria: Healthy nonobese men woman Subjects diabetes history obesity surgery modest health problem
